text: A block and tackle is used to raise a load of 250N through a vertical distance of 30m. What is the efficiency of the system if the work done against friction is 1500J?
explanation:
Y = \(\frac{work output}{work input} \times \frac{100}{1}\)Y = \(\frac{250 \times 30}{250 \times 30 + 1500} \times \frac{100}{1}\)

text: The equation of a wave traveling in a horizontal direction is expressed as y = 15 sin \(\frac{2\pi}{5}\) (60t - x). What is its wavelength?
explanation:
Given: y = 15 sin \(\frac{2\pi}{5}\) (60t - x).
comparing  y = 15 sin \(\frac{2\pi}{5}\) (60t - x) with the equation of wave motion Asin\(\frac{2\pi}{\lambda}\)(x - vt)
\(\frac{2\pi}{5}\) = \(\frac{2\pi}{\lambda}\)
Therefore, \(\lambda\) = 5m.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Which of the following factors will affect the velocity of sound?

options.A: An increase in the pitch of the sound
options.B: An increase in the loudness of the sound
options.C: Wind travelling in the same direction of the sound
options.D: A change in the atmospheric pressure at constant temperature

explanation:
Pitch, loudness, and atmospheric pressure do not affect sound velocity. Wind traveling in the same direction of sound affects its velocity. wind canslow down or accelerate the speed of sound, depending on whether it is blowing in the same direction or in the opposite direction to the sound signal.
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: The characteristic of a vibration that determines its intensity is the
explanation:
The higher the amplitude of sound the larger the loudness of sound and the lower the amplitude of sound waves the softer the loudness of sound by this we get to know that the amplitude of a sound wave decides the loudness of sound or we can call it the intensity of sound.

text: If a reverse-biased voltage is applied across a p-n junction, the depletion layer width is
explanation:
The width of the depletion layer in a p-n junction diode increases in reverse bias as charge carriers are swept into battery terminals, holes from the p-type into the negative terminal, and electrons from the n-type into the positive terminal.
